vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg Struct Reference
VPS Driver API » VPS - Common API » VPS - Common Data Types and macros

Associate capture stream ID with the ISP stream ID. More...

#include <vps_isscommon.h>

Data Fields

uint32_t numStream
 
uint32_t captStreamId [VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_MAX]
 
vpsissStreamId_t ispStreamId [VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_MAX]
 
Ptr pAdditionalArgs
 

Detailed Description

Associate capture stream ID with the ISP stream ID.

struct vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg

Attention
This IOCTL is mandatory for on-the-fly capture
Warning
Deviation from naming convention: To enable backward compatibility

Field Documentation

uint32_t vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg::captStreamId[VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_MAX]

Capture Stream Identifier

vpsissStreamId_t vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg::ispStreamId[VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_MAX]

Associated ISP stream Identifier. e.g. consider use case where in an CSI2 stream is received and processed on the fly (via ISP) to generate 2 different streams Stream 1 - YUV422 video stream of resolution 1280x960 via ReSizer A of ISP Associated Capture Stream Identifier is 1 Stream 3 - Auto White Balance data for this stream Associated Capture Stream Identifier is 2

numStream = 2;
captStreamId[0] = 1U;
ispStreamId[0] = VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_RSZ_A;
captStreamId[1U] = 2U;
ispStreamId[1U] = VPS_ISS_STREAM_ID_AEWB;
uint32_t vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg::numStream

Specify the number of ISP streams that are enabled in ISP. Please note that only the stream that ISP could write is valid. Please refer vpsissStreamId_t for valid write streams.

Ptr vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg::pAdditionalArgs

Not used for now - should be set to NULL
